articles.headline: After U.S. Compromise, Security Council Strengthens North Korea Sanctions
articles.snippet: The Security Council adopted a measure that sets a modest cap on oil imports to North Korea, far weaker than what the United States had sought.
articles.abstract: The Security Council adopted a measure that sets a modest cap on oil imports to North Korea, far weaker than what the United States had sought.
articles.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS — The United Nations Security Council on Monday ratcheted up sanctions yet again against North Korea, but they fell significantly short of the far-reaching penalties that the Trump administration had demanded just days ago.

articles.headline: Decades After Alcohol Ban, Iran Admits It Has a Problem
articles.snippet: Drinking remains a crime, but Alcoholics Anonymous is flourishing and dozens of private and government clinics have opened alcohol rehabilitation centers.
articles.abstract: Drinking remains a crime, but Alcoholics Anonymous is flourishing and dozens of private and government clinics have opened alcohol rehabilitation centers.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — For most of his life, alcohol rehab for Mehdi consisted of regular stretches in prison and lashings that left dark marks on his back. Now, at 36, he has prematurely gray hair, but with the help of an Alcoholics Anonymous group he swears he has finally stopped drinking.

articles.headline: In Florida, a Storm’s Fright Gives Way to a Blackout’s Troubles
articles.snippet: In Hurricane Irma’s wake, the most widely felt damage has been to the state’s electricity system, with millions of customers left without power.
articles.abstract: In Hurricane Irma’s wake, the most widely felt damage has been to the state’s electricity system, with millions of customers left without power.
articles.lead_paragraph: TAMPA, Fla. — The homecoming was a relief, at first: Across much of Florida, evacuees emerged from temporary shelters on Monday to find that Hurricane Irma had spared most houses and lives.
articles.byline: By Jess Bidgood and Vivian Yee

articles.headline: For One Hedge Fund, a Bet on the Affordable Care Act Sours
articles.snippet: Glenview Capital Management’s investment in a large hospital chain, Tenet, has proved disappointing as the industry struggles to adapt.
articles.abstract: Glenview Capital Management’s investment in a large hospital chain, Tenet, has proved disappointing as the industry struggles to adapt.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wagering that the new federal health care law would be a boon, the billionaire investor Larry Robbins bet big on hospital stocks five years ago. Those investments helped propel his hedge fund, Glenview Capital Management, to the ranks of the top-performing funds in 2013.
articles.byline: By Julie Creswell and Reed Abelson

articles.headline: Damp, Dark and Disarrayed, Florida Starts Coping With Irma’s Aftermath
articles.snippet: Widespread power losses and localized flooding caused by the hurricane threatened to bedevil the state for days, if not weeks, to come.
articles.abstract: Widespread power losses and localized flooding caused by the hurricane threatened to bedevil the state for days, if not weeks, to come.
articles.lead_paragraph: Read the latest on the storm with Tuesday’s live updates on Irma.
articles.byline: By Jess Bidgood, Henry Fountain and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: Hurricane Price Gouging Is Despicable, Right? Not to Some Economists
articles.snippet: Eliminating price controls can increase the available supply of essential goods, the argument goes, and help prevent a black market.
articles.abstract: Eliminating price controls can increase the available supply of essential goods, the argument goes, and help prevent a black market.
articles.lead_paragraph: When a devastating hurricane like Irma or Harvey arrives, stories about price gouging inevitably spread quickly. Last week, a one-way coach flight from Miami to Phoenix jumped in price from $547.50 to $3,258.50, prompting immediate outrage. In Houston, a picture of a case of water being sold for $42.96 at Best Buy did the same. (Best Buy apologized and said it was a “big mistake” by a few employees.)

articles.headline: Florida Keys Battered but Still Standing After Irma’s Rampage
articles.snippet: The Florida Keys, which took some of Hurricane Irma’s hardest blows Sunday and Monday, were a random mix of buildings unscathed and others battered or ruined.
articles.abstract: The Florida Keys, which took some of Hurricane Irma’s hardest blows Sunday and Monday, were a random mix of buildings unscathed and others battered or ruined.
articles.lead_paragraph: CUDJOE KEY, Fla. — You pay a price for paradise.

articles.headline: Chief Executive of Social Finance, an Online Lending Start-Up, to Step Down
articles.snippet: Mike Cagney, a co-founder of Social Finance, is stepping down as chief executive and chairman after sexual harassment claims at the start-up.
articles.abstract: Mike Cagney, a co-founder of Social Finance, is stepping down as chief executive and chairman after sexual harassment claims at the start-up.
articles.lead_paragraph: Social Finance, an online lender that is one of the more prominent financial technology start-ups, said on Monday that its co-founder and chief executive Mike Cagney planned to step down by the end of the year.
articles.byline: By Katie Benner and Nathaniel Popper

articles.headline: South Korea Plans ‘Decapitation Unit’ to Try to Scare North’s Leaders
articles.snippet: The government is pouring money into strategies and weapons it hopes will act as a deterrent against Kim Jong-un, the nuclear-armed dictator across the border.
articles.abstract: The government is pouring money into strategies and weapons it hopes will act as a deterrent against Kim Jong-un, the nuclear-armed dictator across the border.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — The last time South Korea is known to have plotted to assassinate the North Korean leadership, nothing went as planned.

articles.headline: Median U.S. Household Income Up for 2nd Straight Year
articles.snippet: Household income rose by 3.2 percent in 2016 as the recovery delivered growing prosperity. Health coverage broadened and poverty declined.
articles.abstract: Household income rose by 3.2 percent in 2016 as the recovery delivered growing prosperity. Health coverage broadened and poverty declined.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Despite eight years of economic growth since a brutal recession, some politicians and economists have worried that many Americans have not felt the benefits of the expansion.

articles.headline: Tesla Self-Driving System Faulted by Safety Agency in Crash
articles.snippet: In a fatal accident last year, the National Transportation Safety Board said, the automaker allowed autonomous driving in unsuitable conditions.
articles.abstract: In a fatal accident last year, the National Transportation Safety Board said, the automaker allowed autonomous driving in unsuitable conditions.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even as the government moved Tuesday to open a clearer path for automakers to develop driverless cars, its leading safety agency waved a new warning flag.
articles.byline: By Neal E. Boudette and Bill Vlasic
